channel.title: PHP Status

item.title: PHP Status
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:17, topic:431923”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=534630.msg3909236#msg3909236 date=1328542663]

It generally doesn’t allow that on shared hosts, even paid ones.

If you ask nicely they will. Host gator opened my outgoing 43595 port on my shared no questions asked.
[/quote]Alright great! Thanks Alot! Also, will they open 5555 too? (or what ever it is)[/quote]

You are paying them money, I’m sure if you are professional about it, they will. If they don’t just act like you know another webhost that will do it for you. In the case that they won’t do it, say you are thinking about switching.

Any business that treasures money will eventually fold to such an easy request.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Status
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

If you want an easy test to see if it will allow you to open sockets, just do fsockopen(‘moparisthebest.com’, 80); If that gives an error, then you probably aren’t allowed to open remote sockets via php.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

runewings317:

How do I open the socket? :o

The status page is working as it is supposed to, if the socket is closed then it appears offline.

item.title: PHP Status
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:4, topic:431923”]@justaguy
Ok Thanks. I think I know what you mean but I don’t have a paid domain and I don’t think 000webhost has what I need :S

@Taharok

The IP_ADRESS is an actual IP, just not putting it for security reasons :3

So I’m guessing what justaguy said was right. :P[/quote]

Actually it’s saying exactly what’s wrong: connection timed out. This indicates the socket is not open.

item.title: PHP Status
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Remove the ‘@’ and run it again. @ silences the method, meaning any errors or exceptions being thrown aren’t sent to the output buffer. If there is a permissions error or an dns lookup, you’d never know so long as it’s silenced.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Status
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Make sure your host allows sockets to be made to remote servers.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Status
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

So basically I’ve been trying to set up MITB toplist he released. But it keeps saying that it’s offline when I test the registering… :S The code that checks it looks OK to me also.

// now that the ip and port are validated, check to make sure the server is online $fp = @fsockopen($ip, $port, $errno, $errstr, 4); if (!$fp) { error("The server " . $name . " is offline, it must be online before you can register it here."); return false; }

That’s the code :S Help please? lol

Read full topic
